page.title: 06FARMING BOREHAM NORTH
page.content: There are a number of farms in the area, three of which were visited. Stocks Farm,one of a group,has soil that is a mixture of clay and gravel,is used for growing the following crops. Winter Wheat, Potatoes, Sugar-beet, Winter Barley and Oil_seed-rape. The latter having become popular in this area during the last few years. It was grown in the North of England,but was prone to disease. At present it is disease free here.Grain is sold to the government through the invention scheme, and beans are grown under contract to Batchelors, who dry them and sell them abroad, mostly to America, a good market for dried foods. The farmer said he was brought up on a farm, and loves the life. He would not consider doing anything other than farming.
